newsitem.title: USA: Southwest expects decline in Q1 earnings.
newsitem.headline: Southwest expects decline in Q1 earnings.

text.p: Southwest Bancorp Inc said Friday that earnings for the first quarter of 1997 are expected to be "significantly less" than earnings of recent quarters.

It said the expected decline is due to an anticipated increase in the company's provision for loan losses. The provision may be required, it said, in connection with a commercial loan with a balance of $1.9 million.
Southwest, parent of Stillwater National Bank and Trust Co, said it received information regarding recent events that may affect the borrower's ability to fully repay the loan.
It did not identify the borrower.
It said the adverse effect on net income of the company has not yet been determined and the net income effect of the anticipated provision will be reduced by applicable tax benefits.
